title: An Effective Rigid String at $\theta=\pi$ for the 3D Gauge Theories/Ising Model
abstract: An effective sigma model describing behavior of the 3d rigid string with a $\theta$-term at $\theta=\pi$ is proposed. It contains non-perturbative corrections resulting from summation over different genera of the 2d surfaces. The effective theory is the $SU(2)$ WZW model coupled to the Nambu-Goto action. RG analysis shows the existence of a IR fixed point at which the normal to the surface has long range correlations. A similar model can describe critical behaviour of the 3d Y-M fields or the Ising model.
